title: Minor visionOS 1.1.1 update provides bug fixes and security updates
content:
Macworld

Apple has released visionOS 1.1.1, a minor update to visionOS 1.1 released earlier this month. The release notes only state:

This update provides important bug fixes and security updates and is recommended for all users.

The highlight is probably the security updates, which are as yet unspecified. The Apple security releases page lists “details coming soon” for this release, which is often the case when it fixes a security flaw that has been actively exploited in the wild—waiting until the update is more broadly available and applied before letting bad actors know that the door has been closed.

How to update to visionOS 1.1.1

  1. Go to Settings > General > Software Update.
  2. If an update is available, tap Download and Install or Install Now. You might need to enter your Apple Vision Pro passcode.
  3. When the update is ready to install, an alert asks you to take off your Apple Vision Pro. You can see the progress of the update on the front of your device with EyeSight.
